Key Arguments: The bill restricts freedom of expression unreasonably.
Truth is discovered through discourse and debate, which the bill would limit.
Truth is ambiguous and nuanced, not dictated by authority.
The bill would give authoritarian powers to a government body, making it an arbiter of truth.
The bill does not protect people from misinformation and disrupts the discovery of truth.
Notable Quotes: Truth is not handed down by authority rather it reveals itself through discussion and discovery.
This bill seeks to instill authoritarian powers into a government body that will seemingly become an arbiter of truth.
